Answers.prompt: If salt is so bad for cars , why do we use it on the roads ? As the title states , why do we use it ? is there no other option or what ? Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: I'm happy to explain like you're five! So, you know how cars need to move on the road, right? Well, sometimes the road can be slippery, especially when it's wet or icy. That can make it hard for the car's tires to grip the road, and it can be dangerous to drive.That's where salt comes in! Salt helps make the road less slippery, so cars can drive safely. It works by making the water on the road freeze, which creates little bumps on the road that the tires can grip. It's like putting studs on the tires, but instead of putting them on the tires, we put them on the road! Now, you might be wondering why we use salt instead of something else. Well, salt is really good at making things slippery, and it's also really cheap! That's why we use it on the roads instead of something else. Plus, it's easy to spread and it works really well, so it's a good choice for keeping the roads safe. So, that's why we use salt on the roads! It helps keep the roads safe for cars to drive on, and it's cheap and easy to use.
Answers.chatGpt3: Salt is used on roads to help melt ice and snow and improve traction during the winter months. When it's cold outside, water can freeze on the roads and make them very slippery, which can be dangerous for cars and people. Salt helps to melt the ice and snow by lowering the freezing point of water, which means that it can help keep the roads clear and safe to travel on. There are other options for melting ice and snow on roads, such as using chemicals like calcium chloride or magnesium chloride, or using mechanical methods like plows or sand. However, salt is often the most effective and affordable option for many communities, especially when it's used in combination with other methods. It's important to note that while salt can be helpful for making roads safer during the winter, it can also have negative effects on the environment and on the cars themselves. Salt can cause corrosion on metal surfaces, including cars, and it can also harm plants and animals if it washes into nearby waterways. However, despite these potential downsides, many communities continue to use salt as a way to keep roads clear and safe during the winter.
Answers.human: salt is good for not dying in car crashes and car crashes are worse for cars then salt . Some places use other things , but salt is really cheap compared to most alternatives , although sand is pretty good .

Answers.chatGpt3: There are a few reasons why we still have SD (standard definition) TV channels: 1. Some people still use older TVs that are not compatible with HD (high definition) signals. These TVs can only display SD channels, so if we only had HD channels, those people wouldn't be able to watch TV. 2. HD channels take up more bandwidth than SD channels, so it's not possible to have as many HD channels as we have SD channels. This means that if we only had HD channels, some channels might not be available. 3. HD channels also require more expensive equipment to produce, so some TV stations might not be able to afford to upgrade to HD. Overall, it's important to have both SD and HD channels so that everyone can watch TV, regardless of what kind of TV they have or how much money they have.
Answers.human: The way it works is that old TV stations got a certain amount of bandwidth to replace their old analog TV stations . However , HD takes up more bandwidth then SD - so the stations can choose between 2 or 3 HD stations , or like 7 or 8 SD stations ( or a mix of both ) They can do a bunch of SD stations and make more money in advertizing by running 7 or 8 different reruns of old SD TV shows at a time In fact , those stations often got permanent rights to show an unlimited number of reruns of old syndicated shows in perpetuity . That means they do n't even have to pay anyone to air old eppisodes of _ Star Trek _ or _ Alf _ So basically it 's free money for them , based on being around for a long , long time and having their old rights get upgraded as new technology comes out .

Answers.prompt: How was airplane technology able to advance so quickly after the Wright Brothers ' first flight ? Mainly interested in how aviation was able to be deployed on a large scale during WWI . Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: aviation-history wright-brothers world-war-iThe Wright Brothers' first flight in 1903 was a huge breakthrough, but it was just the beginning of a rapid series of technological advancements in aviation. Here's how airplane technology advanced so quickly, especially during World War I:1. Experimentation and Innovation: The Wright Brothers and other pioneers experimented with different materials, designs, and engines to improve the performance of their aircraft. Learning from Failures: The Wright Brothers and other early aviators had many accidents and failures. They learned from these mistakes and used that knowledge to improve their designs. This "failure is not an option" approach drove innovation and progress.3. Competition and Collaboration: Many aviators and inventors were competing with each other to create the best aircraft. This competition led to the sharing of ideas and techniques, which helped to accelerate progress.4. Government Support: Governments began to take an interest in aviation and provided funding and support for research and development. This helped to accelerate the pace of innovation.5. Mass Production: As aviation became more popular, manufacturers began to produce aircraft on a large scale. This allowed for economies of scale and made aircraft more affordable, which helped to make aviation more accessible to more people.6. World War I: The need for aircraft during World War I created a huge demand for airplanes. This demand drove innovation and rapid progress in aviation technology.During World War I, aviation technology advanced in several ways:1. Engines: Aircraft engines became more powerful and efficient, allowing for faster and longer flights.2. Airframes: Aircraft were made stronger and more durable, allowing for more advanced maneuvers and longer flights.3. Controls: Aircraft controls were improved, making it easier for pilots to fly and maneuver aircraft.4. Communication: Radio communication became more common, allowing pilots to communicate with each other and with ground control.5. Navigation: Navigation techniques were improved, allowing pilots to fly more accurately and over longer distances.Overall, the combination of these factors led to rapid progress in aviation technology during the early 20th century, particularly during World War I.

Answers.prompt: Why do humans have different colored eyes ? What causes / caused people to have different colors of eyes ? Is there a point to the color of your eyes other than superstitions ? Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: Hey there, little buddy! Let me explain why humans have different colored eyes.You know how some people have blue eyes, and some people have brown eyes? Well, it's all because of a special substance in our eyes called melanin. Melanin is like a magical paint that colors our eyes.When we're born, our eyes are very young and don't have much melanin in them. That's why babies have blue eyes, because there isn't enough melanin to give them a different color yet. As we grow up, our bodies start to make more melanin, and it spreads to our eyes, giving them their adult color.Now, here's the magic part: different people have different amounts of melanin in their eyes, and that's why they have different colors! Some people have a lot of melanin, so their eyes look brown or black. Other people have less melanin, so their eyes look blue or green. It's like a special gift from our bodies to make our eyes unique and different from each other.So, is there a point to the color of our eyes other than superstitions? Well, scientists think that the color of our eyes might tell us something about our health and how our bodies are working. For example, people with blue eyes might be more sensitive to certain medicines, and people with brown eyes might be more protected from some diseases. But that's still being studied, so we don't know everything about it yet.So, there you have it! That's why humans have different colored eyes, and why your eyes are so special and unique. And remember, no matter what color your eyes are, you're just as amazing and special as everyone else!
Answers.chatGpt3: The color of your eyes is determined by the amount and type of pigments in your iris, which is the colored part of your eye, and by the way that the iris scatters light. The iris contains two types of pigment: one called melanin, which gives your skin, hair, and eyes their color, and another called lipochrome, which is a yellowish pigment. The combination of these pigments, along with the structure of the iris, determines the color of your eyes. There are many different shades of eye color, ranging from dark brown to light blue, and the most common eye colors are brown, blue, and green. The color of your eyes is determined by your genes, which are the instructions that you inherit from your parents that tell your body how to grow and function. There is no scientific evidence to suggest that the color of your eyes has any special meaning or significance. However, many people believe that the color of your eyes can reveal certain things about your personality or your health, but these beliefs are not supported by scientific evidence. In short, the color of your eyes is simply a result of the combination of pigments and the way that light is scattered by your iris, and it has no special meaning or significance.
Answers.human: Melanin ! Many of the the first known humans existed in the fertile crescent - modern day Iraq and surrounding areas , and it was just as sunny and hot as it is today . Melanin causes skin and eyes to have a darker color , and as a benefit reduced the amount of UV radiation absorbed into the skin . Eventually humans expanded into less hot and sunlit areas allowing for the survival and procreation of people who developed lighter colored eyes and skin because of the lack of need of melanin for survival .

Cheap products: Many products today are made to be cheap and disposable, so when they break or get old, it's easier to just throw them away and buy a new one instead of fixing them. This can be like buying a toy that breaks easily, and instead of trying to fix it, you just throw it away and get a new one.2. Convenience: With busy lives and limited time, people might find it more convenient to just throw away a broken product and buy a new one instead of taking the time to fix it. It's like when you have a toy that's broken, and instead of trying to fix it, you just throw it away and get a new one because it's easier and faster.3. Lack of repair skills: Many people today don't know how to fix things because they didn't learn those skills from their parents or grandparents, who might have been more skilled at repairing things. It's like when you want to fix a toy, but you don't know how, so you just throw it away and get a new one.4. Changing values: In the past, people might have valued fixing things more because they had to work harder to get the things they needed. Answers.human: EDIT , Nov 21 : By popular demand , now includes Midrange decks and Limited formats . Also , a new section on where players get their cards . Magic : The Gathering is a collectable card game . It can be played in several different formats , but in the most common , two players create decks out of the cards they own and play against each other . Generally , the cards in a deck are either lands or spells . Lands provide the energy needed to cast spells , and spells usually do one of the following : - Summon a creature that can fight for you or an artifact that you can use . ( * * Creatures * * and * * Artifacts * * ) - Create a lasting effect that affects the game as a whole or one or more cards in play . ( * * Enchantments * * ) - Create an instantaneous effect that affects one or more cards in play or an effect that lasts a single turn . ( * * Sorceries * * and * * Instants * * ) - Summon a sort of  teammate  that has its own abilities . ( * * Planeswalkers * * ) The primary goal is to run your opponent out of life points by attacking him with creatures or damaging him directly with spells . There are other ways to win , such as running your opponent out of cards in his deck . The gameplay is complex . The players take turns , but many types of spells can be cast on an opponent 's turn , or in response to a spell that they are trying to cast . A critical play by one player may be countered by the other , and that counter itself countered by the first . There are many thousands of cards out there , and you are not expected to know about them all . The Comprehensive Rules ( * not * including the text of cards ) are nearly two hundred pages , although a lot of that consists of old mechanics that are rarely used or highly - specified details that are rarely relevant . The learning curve is pretty steep , but a few games suffice to learn the basic rules . The complexity is more similar to Dungeons and Dragons than to most card games . A key feature of M : tG is the concept of * * color * * . There are five colors : Red , Green , White , Blue , Black . Each is  allied  to two others and  opposed  to the two others . Most spells require mana of a certain color to cast , which is produced by different types of land cards . Each color has distinct strengths and weaknesses â€“ for example , blue has the best counterspells , but it 's not very good at simply hitting things . A given deck will usually use from one to three colors of card , although in some situations decks with four or five colors can work . In addition , it is often considered that there are three general archetypes of deck ( with a * lot * of variation within each category ) : - * * Aggro * * decks focus on dealing damage ASAP to win ASAP . They usually have cheap creatures (  weenies  ) that can be used right away and  buff-type spells to eke out a few more points of damage . They usually win fast or not at all , because they often ca n't stand up to the more powerful creatures and spells that are played later in the game . - * * Control * * decks focus on preventing the opponent from acting until the player is ready to win with powerful spells or abilities . They run a lot of counterspells , destruction spells , and things that make action more expensive for the opponent , along with a few creatures strong on defense and disruption . They usually win by using cheap defenses against expensive attacks until they are ready to overwhelm the opponent with their accumulated strength , and lose if they just ca n't stay ahead of the enemy 's attacks . - * * Combo * * decks rely on a few combinations of cards that can lead to a near - instant victory . There * are * infinite combos in M : tG , but they 're designed to be difficult or resource - intensive to pull off . A combo deck will usually run ( in addition to the all - important combo pieces )  tutor  cards that let them search their deck , protection cards to guard the combo pieces , and just enough stall cards to prevent a quick defeat . A combo deck wins when it gets its combo in place before losing , and loses if it ca n't get the combo out in time or ca n't protect it long enough to use it . - * * Midrange * * decks are a common intermediate archetype between Aggro and Control . Midrange tries to beat down the opponent with damage from powerful creatures ( colloquially ,  fatties  ) rather than with cheap ones (  weenies  ) . These decks have to run enough control to stay alive until the big hitters come out . They win when they get the hitters out early enough to do lethal damage , and lose when they ca n't get the big guys out at all ( being out - controlled ) or when they just take too much of a beating too early ( being out - aggro'd ) . --- Many different kinds of people play M : tG. There are professional players who win large sums at tournaments , groups of friends who play casually on the weekends , and everything in between . If you 're playing competitively , it can be absurdly expensive , as you can not compromise on getting the perfect cards for your deck , but if you and your opponents are playing casually , it 's a lot cheaper . The most common formats are as follows . Two - player games are the norm for tournaments , but casual matches are often multiplayer . * * Constructed * * formats call for pre - constructed decks built from each player 's personal collection : - * * Standard * * : Decks are made of cards printed in about the last 18 months . - * * Modern * * : Decks are made of cards printed since about 2003 ( minus a ban list ) . - * * Legacy * * : Decks are made of * any * cards ( minus a ban list ) . - * * Vintage * * : Decks are made of * any * cards ( minus a * very small * ban list ) . - * * Commander * * ( or  EDH  ): Decks are made of * any * cards ( minus a ban list ) , but limited to one of each card . One creature card is designated as your  commander  and is nearly always available for summoning . A popular multiplayer format . * * Limited * * formats feature decks made on the spot from a limited pool of cards : - * * Sealed * * : Each player opens several randomized booster packs and makes a deck from the contents . - * * Draft * * : A group of players open many packs and use a system to pick their cards from the contents , then build a deck from what they have . These formats cost money each time to play , because you need to buy booster packs . However , you can play them without having any of your own cards beforehand . Limited play can be a good way to pick up more cards . A relatively new casual format is * * Cube * * , in which you and your group put together a large pile of cards beforehand and use them in place of booster packs . This eliminates the recurring expense , although you need to have enough cards beforehand . There are others formats , including Conspiracy , Planechase , Pauper ( use no rare cards ) . Two - Headed Giant ( play with a partner ) , and many more . Formats that allow older cards tend to be more expensive , because the cards have been out of print for a long time . Commander is a bit cheaper than other formats that allow old cards , because you only can have one of each card ( other formats usually allow up to four of each card ) . I play Commander with my D & D group . None of us puts that much money into it , and we try to keep it more fun than competitive . Some of the players also play in local mini - tournaments on Friday nights (  Friday Night Magic  ) , usually breaking about even . --- So , where does one get cards ? Most cards come from randomized booster packs with 15 cards each . Cards from a given set are designated either common , uncommon , rare , or  mythic rare  . You can buy booster packs for around $ 3.50 USD from retailers , or you can buy them as part of a limited tournament . There are also pre - made decks that you can buy directly from Wizards of the Coast . Each one has a theme and cards intended to work together . You wo n't win any tournaments with a pre - made deck , but it can be a good starting point . In addition , there are a couple of products intended for beginners , such as the  Deck - builder 's toolkit  with a semi - randomized selection of cards and a big stack of common lands . ( Common lands are dirt cheap , but it would take quite a few booster packs to get enough to build a deck . ) Most M : tG players trade cards with their friends or at events to get the specific cards they need . In addition , there is a thriving market of single cards at game stores and online . Some very , very old cards are very , very rare and expensive . A single [ Black Lotus ] ( URL_0 ) can cost many thousands of dollars . But these cards are not legal in most formats , and most players will never have seen one in person . When playing casually , your group may allow the use of  proxy  cards to substitute for the pricey ones . Myself , I 've only been playing for a year or so , and I do n't actually own my own cards ! ( My friends have a ton of extra decks to lend out . ) I 'm planning to build my own Commander deck soon , and I 'll be starting from a pre - made deck from Wizards and supplementing it primarily with trades with friends and singles from the internet .

Answers.prompt: What are prions and are they a big deal ? My AP Biology teacher mentioned them alongside viruses but he did n't say much else beyond that they are n't viruses and they deform protein structure . Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: Hey there, little buddy! So, you wanna know about prions? Well, first things first: prions are not viruses, but they can still make you sick! Confused? Don't worry, I'm here to explain! So, you know how our bodies are made up of tiny things called cells? And inside those cells, there are even smaller things called proteins that do lots of important jobs? Like how your body moves, how it grows, and how it keeps you healthy? Well, prions are kinda like proteins, but they're not normal proteins. They're like special little monsters that can change the way normal proteins work! You see, normal proteins have a special shape that helps them do their jobs. But prions have a weird shape that can make normal proteins go all wonky! They're like little protein-shaped monsters that can make all the other proteins in your body go crazy! And that's why prions can make you sick! When they change the shape of normal proteins, it can mess up the way your body works. It's like if you had a bunch of toy cars that all looked the same, but one of them had a weird shape that made it roll in a different way. It might not be as good at doing its job as the other cars! But here's the thing: prions aren't like viruses because they're not alive! They're just little protein monsters that can make proteins go crazy. And they can't reproduce on their own like viruses can. Instead, they need to attach themselves to normal proteins to make them go wonky! So, are prions a big deal? Well, they can be! Some prions can make you really sick, and some can even kill you. But other prions can just make you feel a little bit off. It's like if you had a toy car that was a little bit wonky  it might not be as fun to play with as the other cars! So, that's prions in a nutshell! They're little protein monsters that can make proteins go crazy and make you feel sick. But they're not alive, and they need to attach themselves to normal proteins to make them go wonky. And some prions can be a big deal, while others might just be a little bit wonky!
Answers.chatGpt3: Prions are tiny particles that can cause serious and often fatal diseases in people and animals. They are made up of proteins, which are important building blocks in the body. Normally, proteins have a specific shape that helps them do their job. But prions are abnormal proteins that have a different shape, and they can cause other proteins around them to change shape too. When this happens, it can cause problems in the body because the proteins are not able to work properly. Prions are not viruses, and they do not contain any genetic material (like DNA or RNA) like viruses do. Instead, they are thought to be able to change the shape of proteins by acting as a kind of template for other proteins to copy. Prion diseases can be very serious and are often fatal. Some examples of prion diseases include Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) in humans, and bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE, also known as mad cow disease) in cows. These diseases can be transmitted through contaminated food or medical equipment, but they can also occur spontaneously in some people. There is currently no cure for prion diseases, and they can be difficult to diagnose. Researchers are working to better understand how prions cause disease and to find ways to prevent and treat these conditions.
Answers.human: Like viruses , they are ( groups of ) molecules that reproduce without metabolism . Unlike any other self - replicating system , prions are proteins that have a unique structure . One part of how a protein functions is the amino acid sequence that makes up the primary structure , but the other part is how the proteins folds , either by itself or with the help of other folder - helper proteins . Prions have the same amino acid sequence as their properly folded brethren , but they are folded differently , and they make a chain reaction by folding their brethren to be like them . Cruetzfeld - Jakob disease in humans , Mad Cow disease in cows , and chronic wasting disease in deer , are all prion diseases that affect neuronal proteins .

Answers.prompt: How does depression work in the brain ? And is it more physical of psychological ? ( Both cause and symptoms ) Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: Depression is a complex condition that can affect how you feel, think, and behave. It can be caused by both physical and psychological factors, and it can affect different parts of the brain. Here's a simplified explanation of how depression works in the brain:Imagine your brain as a big factory with many workers (neurons) who are always busy processing information and making decisions. Sometimes, just like a factory can experience a breakdown, your brain can also experience a breakdown, and that's what happens when you feel depressed.One of the key parts of the brain that can be affected by depression is the amygdala, which is like the security guard of the brain. It helps you identify and respond to threats or danger. When you're depressed, your amygdala can become overactive, making you feel anxious, worried, and sad.Another important part of the brain that can be affected by depression is the prefrontal cortex, which is like the boss of the brain. It helps you plan, decide, and solve problems. When you're depressed, your prefrontal cortex can become less active, making it harder for you to focus, remember things, and make decisions.Depression can also affect other parts of the brain, such as the hippocampus, which is like the library of the brain. It helps you remember things and learn new information. When you're depressed, your hippocampus can become smaller, making it harder for you to remember things and learn new things.Now, let's talk about the physical and psychological causes of depression. Physical causes can include things like a lack of sleep, a poor diet, or a medical condition like a thyroid disorder. Psychological causes can include things like stress, trauma, or negative thoughts and beliefs.When you experience a physical or psychological trigger, it can affect the brain's chemistry and cause changes in the levels of different chemicals, like serotonin and dopamine, that help regulate your mood and emotions. These changes can lead to feelings of depression, anxiety, and other negative emotions.In conclusion, depression is a complex condition that can affect the brain's chemistry, structure, and function. It can be caused by physical, psychological, or a combination of both. Understanding the physical and psychological causes of depression can help you develop a more effective treatment plan and improve your overall well-being.
Answers.chatGpt3: Depression is a medical condition that affects the way you feel. It can be caused by a combination of physical, psychological, and environmental factors. In the brain, depression is thought to be caused by an imbalance of certain chemicals called neurotransmitters. These chemicals help transmit messages between nerve cells in the brain. When there is an imbalance of neurotransmitters, it can affect your mood and behavior. Symptoms of depression can be both physical and psychological. Physical symptoms may include changes in appetite and sleep patterns, fatigue, and body aches. Psychological symptoms may include feeling sad or hopeless, losing interest in activities you used to enjoy, and difficulty concentrating. It's important to note that everyone experiences depression differently, and treatment may involve a combination of therapy, medication, and lifestyle changes. If you think you or someone you know may be experiencing depression, it's important to speak with a healthcare provider for a proper evaluation and treatment plan.
Answers.human: As someone who suffers from severe depression I can tell you mine is both physical and psychological . I know in my heart that no matter what circumstances I could ever be subjected to would never change that or get rid of it , it would be more of a genetics thing I suppose . Lately I tried to explain it to a friend and the only thing I can really use as an analogy for me are paper towels . Some are produced cheap and are shit , they tear and do n't soak up shit . These paper towels are still trying to be good but poor genes have them already behind a better crafted towel . Now let 's pretend we have two hammocks with one being designed using the shitty paper towel and one using the really strong and absorbent towel . If you consider each one of life 's problems and also just poor genes as a marble and you were to drop a marble into the hammocks they would eventually fall thru and you would be screwed . I view talking and medicine as a removal of a marble or two and at the end of the day I suppose each person develops ways of removing marbles but the marbles do n't stop coming . This whole life is just a flimsy , soaked towel and I lost my marbles .

Answers.prompt: Why do movie companies build sets rather than film on scene ? Seems like any location will do and seems like it 's cheaper to find an existing location rather than building their own . But I 'm open to being wrong . Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: --user134698Hey there! Let me tell you a secret: movie magic is like a big game of pretend!  When movie companies build sets, they're creating a special place that looks like the real thing, but is actually fake. It's like a big dollhouse for grown-ups! There are a few reasons why movie companies might choose to build sets instead of filming on location. One reason is that they can control the lighting and the look of the place better. If they were to film on location, they might not be able to control the lighting as well, and the location might not look exactly how they want it to.Another reason is that building a set can be cheaper than filming on location. Think about it: if they film on location, they have to travel to that place, which can be expensive. And they might need to pay for special permits or permissions to film there. But if they build a set, they can just use it over and over again, which can save them a lot of money! Plus, building a set gives the movie crew more control over the look and feel of the place. Answers.chatGpt3: There are a few reasons why movie companies might choose to build sets rather than film on location: 1. Control: Building a set allows the filmmakers to have complete control over the look and feel of the environment in which they are shooting. Additionally, the filmmakers may need to pay to use certain locations, or they may have to pay to have the location altered in some way to suit their needs. 3. Logistics: Filming on location can also be logistically challenging. The filmmakers may need to deal with crowds, noise, and other distractions, which can make it difficult to get the shots they need. Additionally, the filmmakers may not have access to all of the resources they need on location, such as electricity, water, or special equipment. 4. By building a set, the filmmakers can create a controlled environment where these hazards are minimized. Overall, building sets can be more expensive upfront, but it can also be more cost-effective in the long run, as it allows the filmmakers to have greater control over their shooting environment and reduce the risk of delays or unexpected costs.

Answers.prompt: What is a  Tor exit node  or  Tor node  What is a  Tor exit node  or  Tor node  ? Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: A Tor exit node is a  Tor relay node that is also a Tor client.  A Tor client is a  computer that is  connecting  to the  Tor network.  A Tor relay node is  a  computer that  is  running  the  Tor software and  is  helping  to  route  traffic  through  the  Tor network.  So,  a  Tor exit node is  a  computer that  is  both  a  Tor client  and  a  Tor relay node.  It  is  connecting  to  the  Tor network  and  helping  to  route  traffic  through  the  network,  and  it  is  also  using  the  Tor network  to  connect  to  other  computers  on  the  internet.  Think  of  it  like  a  post  office  box.  You  can  send  a  letter  to  the  post  office  box  and  the  letter  will  be  forwarded  to  the  recipient.  In  the  same  way,  a  Tor exit node  is  like  a  post  office  box  that  forwards  traffic  to  other  computers  on  the  internet.  It  is  a  way  to  keep  your  internet  activity  private  and  secure.  A  Tor node  is  a  computer  that  is  running  the  Tor software  and  is  helping  to  route  traffic  through  the  Tor network.  It  can  be  either  a  Tor relay node  or  a  Tor exit node.  A  Tor relay node  is  a  computer  that  is  running  the  Tor software  and  is  helping  to  route  traffic  through  the  Tor network,  but  it  is  not  a  Tor client.  It  is  just  a  computer  that  is  helping  to  route  traffic  through  the  network.  A  Tor exit node  is  a  computer  that  is  both  a  Tor client  and  a  Tor relay node.  It  is  a  way  to  keep  your  internet  activity  private  and  secure.
Answers.chatGpt3: A Tor node is a computer that is part of the Tor network. The Tor network is a group of computers that work together to provide anonymity to internet users. When you use the Tor network, your internet traffic is routed through multiple Tor nodes before it reaches its final destination. A Tor exit node is a special type of Tor node that is the last stop for your internet traffic before it reaches its final destination. When you use the Tor network to access a website, your traffic is encrypted and routed through multiple Tor nodes before it reaches the exit node. The exit node then decrypts your traffic and sends it on to the website you are trying to access. The purpose of the Tor network is to provide anonymity to internet users by routing their traffic through multiple nodes and encrypting it. This makes it difficult for anyone to track your online activity or figure out where you are located.
Answers.human: I 'm going to go off the assumption that you do n't know what tor is , if you do then feel free to skip the next paragraph . The entire idea behind tor is that by bouncing your information through different relay points , each of which is secured and the data transfers between them are encrypted , thus making your communications much harder to trace back to you . If I turn on my computer and use a regular browser , lets say Firefox , my computer requests that a specific bit of information from , lets say , reddit . My request is sent from my computer , to my ISP 's servers , to the servers of the website and then takes the little bit of information , lets say a specific webpage , and then does that same process in reverse . Taking the information from the servers of the website to the ISP 's servers and then back to my computer . Tor complicates this process by , rather then doing a straight line of data from computer to ISP to site , first encrypting all the communication and then secondly bouncing that signal / request for data around before submitting the request for information . This has the effect of making you appear like your in another place and posses a different IP address then you actually do . Simply put , a Tor node is one of the small parts of the jump that obfuscates your physical location and IP address by bouncing your information . An exit node is a tor node that serves as the ' exit ' point from the tor network and sends the actual request for information from the site . Hopefully that clears this up , if you have anymore questions just ask . :)

Answers.prompt: How does DRM work ? Digital Rights Management . The wikipedia page goes off in many directions . First hit my radar with the Xbox One stuff . How does DRM work and why is it so controversial ? Thank you ! Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: Hey there, little buddy! Let me tell you all about DRM, or Digital Rights Management. It's like a special trick that helps people who make things like movies, music, and books keep control of how those things are used.So, you know how sometimes you might borrow a toy from a friend, and they tell you that you can only play with it in your room, and not in the living room or outside? That's kind of like what DRM does, but for digital things like movies and music.When someone makes a digital thing, like a movie or a song, they want to make sure that people can only use it in certain ways. For example, they might want to make sure that you can only watch the movie on your own computer, and not on someone else's computer. Or they might want to make sure that you can only listen to the song on your own phone, and not on someone else's phone.So, to do this, they use something called DRM. DRM is like a special code that's hidden inside the digital thing, like a secret message that only the person who made the thing can understand. And when you try to use the thing, like watch the movie or listen to the song, the DRM code checks to make sure that you're only using it in the way that the person who made it intended.Now, some people don't like DRM, because it can make it harder to use the things that they want to use. For example, if you buy a movie and try to watch it on a different computer or phone, the DRM might not let you do it. Some people think that this is unfair, because they paid for the movie and they should be able to watch it wherever they want.So, that's why DRM can be a bit controversial. But, it's also important to remember that the people who make digital things, like movies and music, need to make money from their work. And if they can't control how their things are used, then they might not be able to make new things. It's a bit like how you might need to pay for a toy or a game, and then you can play with it whenever you want.I hope that helps! Do you have any other questions about DRM?
Answers.chatGpt3: Digital Rights Management (DRM) is a technology that is used to protect and control access to digital content, such as music, movies, ebooks, and software. It is often used by media companies, content creators, and publishers to prevent unauthorized copying and distribution of their content. There are many different ways that DRM can be implemented, but generally it works by encrypting the content and requiring users to authenticate themselves before they can access it. For example, if you want to play a song that has DRM on it, you may need to enter a special code or password in order to unlock it. DRM can be controversial because it can make it more difficult for people to use the content that they have purchased in the way that they want to. For example, if you buy a song from a store and it has DRM on it, you may not be able to play it on all of your devices, or you may have to jump through some hoops to get it to work. This can be frustrating for users, especially if they feel like they are paying for something that they can't fully use. There are also concerns about DRM being used to track users or limit their freedom to use the content in certain ways. Some people believe that DRM is unnecessary and that it does more harm than good, while others argue that it is necessary to protect the rights of content creators and prevent piracy.
Answers.human: The reason wikipedia goes off in many directions is because it 's a generic term , it does n't describe any single technique . It 's just attempting to get people to pay you for their thing , preventing them from pirating it . It 's controversial because a lot of DRM implementations tend to be very inconvenient for the legit customers , whereas the people that would pirate your product will likely be able to do it anyway , and because their copy is cracked , they do n't see the downside of the restrictive DRM . It literally only hurts the paying customers , which in turn forces more people to pirate . Nobody wins .

Answers.llama2: I'm not sure if it's a good idea to use the word "forced" in this context, as there are many alternatives to traditional banking that can be used to receive income. For example, you can set up direct deposit to automatically receive your paycheck into your bank account, and you can use online banking or mobile banking apps to check your balance, pay bills, and transfer money between accounts.Thirdly, banks offer a high level of security and fraud protection, which can give you peace of mind when receiving and managing your income. For example, banks often have systems in place to detect and prevent fraudulent activity, such as unauthorized transactions or identity theft.Finally, using a bank to receive your income can also make it easier to save money and plan for the future. Banks offer a range of savings accounts and investment products that can help you grow your wealth over time, and they often offer financial advice and resources to help you make the most of your money.In short, using a bank to receive your income is not necessarily a "forced" situation, but rather a choice that many people make because it's a safe, secure, and convenient way to manage their finances.

Answers.prompt: Why can does bark what seems like forever but people can only scream for a hour or two ? I mean some dogs wo n't shut up and constantly yap . Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: It's because dogs and humans have different vocal cords and ways of making sounds. Dogs have a special kind of vocal cord called a "laryngeal prominence" that lets them bark for a long time without getting tired. Humans don't have this special vocal cord, so we can only make sounds for a little while before our voices get hoarse and tired.Imagine you're playing a trumpet. You can make a loud sound by blowing air through the trumpet, but if you keep blowing for a long time, your lips might get tired and you might start making more and more quiet sounds. That's kind of like what happens when humans try to scream for a long time - our voices get tired and we can't make as much noise anymore.Dogs don't get tired when they bark, though, so they can keep going and going! It's like they have a special kind of trumpet in their throat that never gets tired.

Some dogs are more prone to barking than others, and some breeds are known for being more vocal than others. People can only scream for a short period of time because our bodies are not built to handle the strain of screaming for long periods of time. Screaming uses a lot of energy and can be very tiring, which is why people can only do it for a short period of time before they need to rest. Dogs, on the other hand, are built differently and are able to bark for longer periods of time without getting as tired. Dogs also have different vocal cords than humans, which may make it easier for them to bark for longer periods of time without damaging their vocal cords.

Answers.prompt: What will happen to the United States economy as our debt increases and we continue to ignore it ? Will we eventually have to pay it off ? What if we do n't ? Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: The United States economy is like a big piggy bank. When the government spends more money than it takes in, it puts more money into the piggy bank. This is called debt.Just like how you can't put more toys in your piggy bank than you have money in it, the government can't spend more money than it has. But sometimes the government does this anyway.When the government spends more money than it has, it has to borrow money from other people to make up the difference. This is like taking money out of your piggy bank and giving it to someone else.The problem is that the government has been borrowing a lot of money lately, and it's getting harder and harder to pay it all back. This is like taking too many toys out of your piggy bank and not having enough money left to buy more toys.If the government keeps borrowing too much money, it might not be able to pay it all back. This could cause big problems for the economy, like making it harder for people to find jobs or buy houses.Eventually, the government will have to pay back all the money it borrowed. This might be hard, because it will have to take money away from other things, like roads, schools, and the military.If the government can't pay back all the money it borrowed, it could cause even bigger problems, like inflation (when money isn't worth as much as it used to be) or even a financial crisis (like what happened in 2008).So, it's important for the government to be careful about how much money it borrows and makes sure it has enough money to pay it all back. Just like how you have to be careful not to take too many toys out of your piggy bank, the government has to be careful not to borrow too much money.
Answers.chatGpt3: It's important for countries, just like people, to manage their debts responsibly. If a country has too much debt, it can be difficult for it to borrow money in the future and investors may be less likely to lend it money. This can make it harder for the country to fund things like infrastructure, education, and healthcare. If a country is not able to pay off its debts, it could default on its loans. This means that it would not be able to make the required payments to its lenders and could potentially lead to financial problems for the country. It's important for countries to try to pay off their debts, but it's not always possible to do it all at once. Instead, they might make a plan to gradually pay off their debts over time. This is called a debt repayment plan. In the case of the United States, the government has a lot of debt, but it also has a strong economy and is able to borrow money at low interest rates. This means that it can afford to pay back its debts over time. However, it's still important for the government to be careful about how much it borrows and to try to live within its means as much as possible.

Answers.prompt: Why are Republicans against giving the LGBT community equality ? I read an article about Democrats wanting to introduce a bill in Congress that would ban discrimination and the like targeted at the LGBT community . For what reasons would conservatives not be in support of this ? Please explain like I'm five.
Answers.llama2: I'll do my best to explain like you're five!You know how sometimes you might see someone who is different from you, like they have different hair or different eyes? Well, some people in the LGBT community are different from most other people because they like to love someone of the same gender, like two girls or two boys.But sometimes, even though they love each other very much, other people might not like them because they think it's weird or different. This can be very hurtful and unfair, just like if you were playing with your friends and someone took away your toy because they didn't like the color.So, some very kind and fair people in Congress want to make sure that everyone, no matter who they love, has the same rights and protections as everyone else. They want to make sure that no one can take away someone's toy just because they don't like the color!Now, some other people, like Republicans, might not be in support of this because they have different beliefs and values. Maybe they think that love should only be between a boy and a girl, and that's that. But that's okay, because everyone is allowed to have their own opinions and beliefs.However, it's important to remember that everyone should be treated equally and with respect, no matter what they believe or who they love. Just like how you would want to be treated with respect and kindness, even if you have different toys or games than someone else.So, that's why some people in Congress want to make sure that everyone is treated equally and with respect, no matter who they love. And that's a very kind and fair thing to do!
Answers.chatGpt3: It's important to note that not all Republicans are against giving the LGBT community equality. In fact, many Republicans support equal rights for the LGBT community. However, there are some conservatives who may not support equal rights for the LGBT community for a variety of reasons. One reason may be due to their religious beliefs. Some conservatives may believe that being gay, lesbian, bisexual, or transgender goes against their interpretation of certain religious texts, and therefore they may oppose laws that would give these groups equal rights. Another reason may be due to a belief in traditional gender roles and sexual orientations. Some conservatives may believe that there are only two genders (male and female) and that people should only be attracted to members of the opposite sex. They may therefore oppose laws that would give equal rights to those who do not fit into these traditional gender roles or sexual orientations. It's also possible that some conservatives may simply not understand or agree with the experiences and perspectives of the LGBT community, and therefore may not support equal rights for them. Overall, it's important to remember that there are many different viewpoints on this issue, and that not everyone may agree on the best way to ensure equal rights for all people, including those in the LGBT community.
Answers.human: From a political perspective , a large voting block for the Republican party are older and very religiously conservative ( Usually Christian , specifically protestant ) . The more conservative forms of Christianity do not favor homosexuality . If the Republican party were to openly support protections for homosexuals ( and others that fall into LGBT categories ) they risk alienating an important voter block , which affects their reelection chances and political power .

Answers.chatGpt3: The sensation of falling in dreams is actually a very common experience and can be caused by a variety of factors. One reason people may experience this sensation is due to changes in their body position while they are sleeping. When you are lying down, your body is in a state of relative stillness. However, if you move or shift positions while you are sleeping, your body may perceive this movement as falling. This can trigger a reflex that causes you to feel like you are falling or to experience a sensation of vertigo. Another reason people may experience the sensation of falling in their dreams is due to changes in their brain activity while they are sleeping. During the dreaming stage of sleep, known as rapid eye movement (REM) sleep, the brain is more active and may produce vivid and sometimes strange or surreal dreams. In some cases, the sensation of falling may be part of the dream content and may be related to the dreamer's feelings or emotions. Finally, the sensation of falling in dreams may be related to the way our brains process and interpret sensory information while we are asleep. During sleep, our brains are still receiving and processing sensory information from our surroundings, even though we are not consciously aware of it. This sensory information may be incorporated into our dreams and may contribute to the vividness and realism of the dream experience. Overall, the sensation of falling in dreams is a normal and common experience that is caused by a combination of factors related to body position, brain activity, and sensory processing during sleep.
Answers.human: When you 're in between deep sleep and the lighter sleep where it 's easy to wake up , the sleep paralysis that stops you from acting out your dreams can do strange shit . Sometimes you 'll be surfacing to wakefulness again when your brain accidently throws the sleep paralysis switch again . The sudden tension in the body can feel like falling to a sleep - frazzled mind , and it galvanizes you strongly it can even create the sensation you 'd dropped onto the bed and bounced . You did n't . Your body just got switched into safe mode by accident .
